item.title: A Guide To MIPS
item.description: ðŸ¤– MIPS Note People often wonder why they should learn MIPS over x64 and ARM assembly. ðŸ‘œ Registers Registers have the following usage conventions: When a register is designated as preserved across calls, it means that the caller can count on the register having the same contents before and after a subprogram call. If the subprogram uses one of these registers, it should take measures to save the register value before changing it and restore the value before returning.
